result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Charles Krawczyk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 08/14/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-4

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's, during period of probation or civil judgment.
- Restitution is set at zero.
- No firearms/weapons. 48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

- Successfully complete "Batterers Intervention" counseling and continue programming.
- Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
- Attend and complete parenting classes.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No contact with victim, wife and child without AOR consent, then No Violence.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Pay costs and fees for case 2014CM1019.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Charles Krawczyk

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.

Defendant Robert C Krawczyk in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Defendant Robert C Krawczyk in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS #1 and #3, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to all other sentences) at the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS.   

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 90 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, wife and child without 
   AOR consent, then no violence.  
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
   -- pay the costs and fees for case 2014CM1019.  
* Restitution is set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 8-14-2015 AT 1:30 PM.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court, defendant Robert C Krawczyk not in court, in custody.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Case was scheduled for the morning calendar, and defense counsel requested to appear in the afternoon on the same date.  Upon the request of defense counsel, case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 3-3-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court, defendant Robert C Krawczyk not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status Conference held off the record.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Upon the request of defense counsel, case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 2-12-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jennifer K

Defendant Robert Charles Krawczyk in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Robert Charles Krawczyk in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
